name: file statistics
desc: Calculate and display statistics about the data contained in the selected file.

properties.name: Switch Property View
properties.desc: Edit the renderable (red) port properties for the module.

properties.name: Use Application Origin
properties.desc: When true, the module will apply the Application Origin. When false, data will be left in internal model space. Turn off when loading data intended to use as a glyph or similar.

properties.name: Component Or Layer
properties.desc: The Data Component is used to select which file data component to process for display.

properties.name: Log Process
properties.desc: Process to compute the log (base 10) of the data value.

properties.name: Log Post Processing Clip Min
properties.desc: Post Processing Clip Min will be used after data processing to replace any sample property value that is less than the specified number in log space.

properties.name: Linear Post Processing Clip Min
properties.desc: Linear Post Processing Clip Min will be used after data processing to replace any sample property value that is less than the specified number in linear space.

properties.name: Detection Limit
properties.desc: The Detection Limit value affects any file values set with the 'ND' or other non-detect flags (for a list of these flags open the help for the APDV file format). When the module encounters this flag in the file it will insert the a value equal to (Detection Limit * LT Multiplier).

properties.name: Less Than Multiplier
properties.desc: The Less Than Multiplier is the value that any sample with the '<' less than flag.

properties.name: Number Of Bins
properties.desc: The Number of Bins value allows the user to specify the bins that will be used to calculate the frequency histogram. The default value of 0 does not calculate a frequency distribution during execution of the module. The user can select any number of bins from 2 to 255 (note that a value of 1 is not valid).

properties.name: Delimiter
properties.desc: The Delimiter specifies how the labels and values in the Output Log are separated. The word TAB will be replaced by a tab advancement.

properties.name: Coordinate Precision
properties.desc: The Coordiante Precision is the number of decimal points to use for coordinate values.

properties.name: Precision
properties.desc: The Precision is the number of decimal points to use for calculated values.

properties.name: Detailed Statistics
properties.desc: The Detail Statistics toggle causes the module to display the original statistical information along with more detailed statistics.

properties.name: Points As Spheres
properties.desc: The Points As Spheres toggle will cause the points to be displayed as spheres.

properties.name: Point Width
properties.desc: The Point Width sets the size of the rendered pixels. The default is 0 which is equivalent to 1.

properties.name: Sphere Radius
properties.desc: The Sphere Radius will set the radius for each sphere when Points As Spheres is on.

properties.name: Chem File Is Time Domain
properties.desc: The Chem File is Time Domain toggle turns on date interpolation for time domain analyte (e.g. chemistry) files.

properties.name: Specify Date By Component
properties.desc: The Specify Date by Component toggle will cause the Date field to be ignored and the date to be selected using the Data Component.

properties.name: Date For Interpolation
properties.desc: The Date For Interpolation field is the date being interpolated to, for example if you have an analyte value of 2 on 1/01/05 and a value of 4 on 1/03/05 and the date is set to 1/02/05 with Direct Interpolation the value should be set to 3. The Date can be either set here or passed in via the Date port.

properties.name: Analyte Name
properties.desc: The Analyte Name field is used for AIDV and APDV time files as the dates take up the spots in these files usually reserved for analyte names.

properties.name: Interpolation Type
properties.desc: There are 5 different Interpolation Methods that are available, each interpolation method is used to define how to interpolate when given non-detects in a file. Please read the module help for a complete description.

properties.name: Use Nearest Measured Data
properties.desc: The Use Nearest Measured Data toggle causes the sample at the interpolated date, to have the same value as the nearest measured date and not an interpolated value.

properties.name: Non Linear Shrink
properties.desc: If the Non-Linear Shrink toggle is selected the size of the sphere will be determined by a cosine interpolation instead of a linear one.
